ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Recording type (for EEG, use eeg_sub_files01 data structure instead of electrography01)
Notes: 0 = Electroantennography (EAG); 1 = Electrical brain stimulation (EBS); 2 = Electrocardiography (ECG/EKG); 3 = Electrocochleography (ECOG); 4 = Electrocorticography (ECoG), also known as intracranial electroencephalography (iEEG); 5 = Electrogastrography (EGG); 6 = Electroglottography (EGG); 7 = Electromyography (EMG); 8 = Electronystagmography (ENG); 9 = Electrooculography (EOG); 10 = Electroolfactography (EOG); 11 = Electropalatography (EPG); 12 = Electroretinography (ERG); 13 = Electroviscerography (EVG), also known as electrogastroenterography (EGEG); 99 = Other

ElementDescription: If other recording type, specify here
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Misc notes regarding the experiment for this subject
Information regarding termination of the experiment
"Information regarding validity (e.g., inclusion criteria, QA assessment, etc.) of the experiment for this subject"
